intro: Parosela fissa, commonly known as the fissured parosela, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Parosela fissa is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
